verses.text: Yo, Paul here—locked up for Jesus, rolling with my bro Timothy—sending love to Philemon, our ride-or-die in faith, and to Apphia, Archippus, and your squad who meet at your place.
Big vibes of grace and peace from God our Father and Jesus hit you hard.
Lowkey, I always thank God when I’m thinking about you,
‘Cause I hear your faith is solid and your love game is strong for Jesus and the crew.
Your faith is poppin’ and your love is real—everyone’s talking about it.
I pray your faith and knowing God keeps leveling up, so you can flex all the good stuff in Him fully.
Your love has seriously hyped up the hearts of God’s squad, Philemon—you’re making moves people notice.
So check this: even though I could boss you around in Christ,
I’m keeping it 100 and appealing to you with love. I, Paul, old-timer and now in chains for Jesus, am asking you personally.
I’m talking about my kid in faith, Onesimus, who’s like a son to me while I’ve been stuck in here.
He was kinda useless before, but now? Total upgrade—he’s useful to both of us, and especially to you.
I’m sending him back to you, but real talk—I’m sending my heart with him too.
I lowkey wanted to keep him here to help me while I’m chained for the gospel,
but I didn’t want to do anything without your say-so—so your move is fully voluntary, not forced.
Honestly, maybe this separation was God’s plan so he could roll back to you forever, not just for a sec.
So now he’s not just a servant—he’s more than that. He’s a beloved brother in Christ. He’s mad important to me, and he should be important to you too.
If you see me as your partner in faith, welcome him like you’d welcome me.
And if he owes you or messed up, don’t stress—count it on me.
Yep, I wrote this myself—Paul, pen in hand. I got this.
Big ask: refresh my heart in Christ.
I’m confident you’ll do even more than I say—your track record is strong.
Can’t wait to swing by soon; maybe you can do me a little favor then so we’re both hyped.
Epaphras, my teammate in Christ Jesus, says hey.
Also sending love from Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke—my fellow workers.
Peace out—may the grace of Jesus Christ be heavy on your spirit.
